name: GetPositionValues
description:
Retrieve available position values for endpoint parameters in Workday.

Use this tool to get a list of position values that can be leveraged as parameters when interacting with other endpoints in the Workday service.

parameters.name: effective_date_for_worker
parameters.description: The effective date to look up time values for a specific worker in Workday.

value_schema.description: The effective date to look up time values for a given worker.

parameters.name: max_response_objects
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of objects to return in a single response. Default and max is 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: response_collection_offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response. Defaults to 0. Use with 'limit' for paging, e.g., limit=5 & offset=9 returns 5 items starting at the 10th.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker for retrieving time values.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker to look up time values for.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The effective date to look up time values for a given worker.

value_schema.description: The effective date to look up time values for a given worker.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default and maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker to look up time values for.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker to look up time values for.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
